# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = split(text, " ") # Split the text into words
    output = String[] # Initialize an array to hold the wrapped lines
    current_line = "" # Current line being built
    for word in lines
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(output, current_line) # Add the current line to the output
            current_line = "" # Start a new line
        end
        current_line *= " $word" # Append the word to the current line
    end
    if current_line != ""
        push!(output, current_line) # Add any remaining content of the last line
    end
    return join(output, "\n") # Join the lines with newlines
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there! How are you today? This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the text into words, and for each word, it checks if appending it to the current line would exceed the specified `text_width`. If so, it adds the current line to the output and starts a new line. After processing all words, it joins the lines back together with newline characters.
